intro: Miconia pujana, commonly known as the Pujaná miconia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub or small tree in humid, shaded environments. Its fruit is a capsule that disperses seeds via wind, contributing to its spread in suitable habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens, though it can become invasive in certain areas.
